author: Zeno of Citium

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: We should not spoil what we have by desiring what we have not; but remember that what we now have was once among the things we only hoped for.

quote: He who is greedy is always in want.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: The goal of life is living in agreement with Nature.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: Well-being is attained little by little, and nevertheless is no little thing itself.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: When a dog is tied to a cart, if it wants to follow, it is pulled and follows, making its spontaneous act coincide with necessity. But if the dog does not follow, it will be compelled in any case. So it is with men too: even if they don't want to, they will be compelled to follow what is destined.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: if being is many, it must be both like and unlike, and this is impossible, for neither can the like be unlike, nor the unlike like

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: The reason why we have two ears and only one mouth is that we may listen the more and talk the less.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: Nothing is more hostile to a firm grasp on knowledge than self-deception.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: All the good are friends of one another.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: We have two ears and one mouth, therefore we should listen twice as much as we speak.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: A friend is our alter ego.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: No loss should be more regrettable to us than losing our time, for it's irretrievable.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: He would stretch his arm out in from of his and show his open palm…and he would point to his hand and say “this is perception”. then he would SLIGHTLY close his fingers…just a little bit…so now he looks like Zeno with arthritis…and he points to his hand NOW and says “This is assent” you know.. agreement or belief in something. then he closes his fist tight and points to it and says “This is Comprehension”. Then he takes his other hand and grabs his fist…holding it closed and says “This is Knowledge.”

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue.
